title: Editorial: Revisiting the limits of plant life - plant adaptations to extreme terrestrial environments relating to astrobiology and space biology
summary: This editorial discusses the critical role of plants in adapting to extreme environments and their potential contributions to human space exploration. It highlights various studies on plant resilience and adaptations that could inform strategies for cultivating plants in extraterrestrial settings, ultimately aiding in the search for life beyond Earth.

sections.text: This editorial presents a collection of articles focusing on plant adaptations to extreme environments and their relevance to astrobiology and space biology.

Plants have played a vital role in the evolution of terrestrial life and are essential for future space missions. This editorial emphasizes the importance of understanding plant adaptations to harsh environments as humanity explores beyond Earth.

The editorial summarizes various studies, including the effects of cosmic radiation on plants, the benefits of co-culturing crops with fungi, and the challenges of germinating seeds in extraterrestrial regolith.
The discussion revolves around the implications of plant adaptations for deep space exploration and the potential for using terrestrial bio-design principles to support human missions.
The editorial concludes that understanding plant survival mechanisms in extreme environments is crucial for future space exploration and the search for extraterrestrial life.
